title: Definitions
context: [ยง89E-1] Definitions. For the purposes of this chapter: &ldquo;Actuarial present value&rdquo; means the difference in value between a member&rsquo;s benefit reflecting termination of service without the special retirement provision and the value of the member&rsquo;s benefit reflecting the special retirement benefit. &ldquo;Agency&rdquo; or &ldquo;attached agency&rdquo; means the Hawaii health systems corporation. &ldquo;Directly affected&rdquo; refers to when an employee receives official reduction-in-force notification of displacement from the employee&rsquo;s position because of a senior employee exercising reduction-in-force rights, or because the employee&rsquo;s position is part of a workforce restructuring plan, including privatization. &ldquo;Employee&rdquo; means an individual: (1) Employed by the state government or an attached agency in a position subject to chapters 88 and 89; (2) Whose position has been identified for abolishment or directly affected because of a reduction-in-force or workforce restructuring plan, including privatization; and (3) Whose employment is subject to Act 103, Session Laws of Hawaii 2015. &ldquo;Exclusive representative&rdquo; has the same meaning as defined in section 89-2. &ldquo;Public employer&rdquo; has the same meaning as defined in section 89-2. &ldquo;Reduction-in-force&rdquo; includes layoffs under chapter 89. [L Sp 2016 2d, c 1, pt of ยง2]
